page.title: 03 *****Life in Chilton*****
page.content: The Didcot bus service is very poor. Buses to Oxford and Newbury may be caught on the main road. Coaches take secondary school children to and from schools in Didcot. There are 2 postal collections and deliveries each day except Sundays. There is a daily milk delivery. The major single employer locally is the United Kingdom Atomic Energy Authority.The Director,Dr.Lewis Roberts lives in the village.Many people commute to work by road or by Didcot Parkway's excellent train service. Other features in the village are a horse training establishment,an orchid nursery,a general store,a garden centre a seed treatment company, 2 farms, 2 public houses, a village hall, allotments and recreation grounds. A mobile library calls fortnightly.
